de.awi.floenavigation.initialsetup

Class CoordinateFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      • de.awi.floenavigation.initialsetup.CoordinateFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.arch.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, android.arch.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnClickListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener

    public class CoordinateFragment
extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment
implements android.view.View.OnClickListener
    This Fragment runs on top of the GridSetupActivity and displays the location of the Fixed Station which is being deployed.

    The MMSIFragment inserts the name and MMSI number in to the tables DatabaseHelper.baseStationTable, DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable and DatabaseHelper.stationListTable. This fragment waits and checks the DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable to see if a Position Report has been received from the given MMSI number. The Position Report PostnReportClassA and PostnReportClassB are received, decoded and inserted in to the Database by AISDecodingService. If a position report is received the fragment displays the location data (Latitude and Longitude) on screen along with the tablet's own location. If the position report is not received for a specified time the MMSIFragment is called again to re-enter MMSI number. The Layout of this fragment shows a ProgressBar with a waiting message when waiting for the Position Report and once it receives the position report it shows the location along with a button. It also checks the length of DatabaseHelper.stationListTable in the button callback, if the length is less than 2 it will start MMSIFragment and if the length is 2 SetupActivity will be started.

    See Also:
    AISDecodingService, GridSetupActivity, Runnable, AISMessageReceiver, PostnReportClassA, PostnReportClassB, SetupActivity, NavigationFunctions

        See Also:

      • changeFormat

        private boolean changeFormat
        Sets the format for display of Geographic Coordinates on the Screen. If true the coordinates will be displayed as degree, minutes, seconds

      • numOfSignificantFigures

        private int numOfSignificantFigures
        Sets the number of significant figures to show after a decimal point on the screen. This does not affect the calculations. The value is read from DatabaseHelper.decimal_number_significant_figures

      • autoCancelTimer

        private int autoCancelTimer
        Variable for keeping track of the time the fragment waits for the Position Report. It is increment every time the fragRunnable runs.

      • MAX_TIMER

        private static final int MAX_TIMER
        A constant value specifying how long the Fragment will wait for a Position Report. Current value is 300 seconds or 5 minutes.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • onCreateView

        public android.view.View onCreateView(android.view.LayoutInflater inflater,
                                      android.view.ViewGroup container,
                                      android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Default Fragment.onCreateView(LayoutInflater, ViewGroup, Bundle). Reads the MMSI number and station name of the Fixed Station passed to it by MMSIFragment. The default layout shows a ProgressBar with a waiting message and a cancel button.

        The fragment runs the fragRunnable to check the DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable if the position data has been inserted by the AISDecodingService. If the data is inserted the Fragment changes its layout to display the received location and the current tablet location. If the data is not yet inserted the fragRunnable increments autoCancelTimer and re-posts the fragRunnable with a delay of checkInterval. If the autoCancelTimer values goes above MAX_TIMER then the MMSI is removed from the DatabaseHelper.baseStationTable, DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable and DatabaseHelper.stationListTable, the fragRunnable is cancelled and control is returned to MMSIFragment to re-enter a valid MMSI number.

        Overrides:
        onCreateView in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment
        Parameters:
        inflater -
        container -
        savedInstanceState -
        Returns:

      • callMMSIFragment

        private void callMMSIFragment()
        Changes the Fragment to MMSIFragment

      • onResume

        public void onResume()
        Called when the Fragment come back from background to foreground. Disables the Up Button.
        Overrides:
        onResume in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(android.view.MenuItem menuItem)
        Default handler for the Action Bar Option Menu of Change Lat/Lon View format. It inverts the value of changeFormat and updates its value in DatabaseHelper.configParametersTable so that the same format is shown throughout the App.
        Overrides:
        onOptionsItemSelected in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment
        Parameters:
        menuItem -
        Returns:

      • onStart

        public void onStart()
        Checks isConfigDone to see which layout to display. If it is true meaning the AIS Position Report has been received the fragment shows the layout displaying the coordinates of the AIS Station and Tablet. Else it displays the waiting view. Registers and implements the BroadcastReceiver for the GPS location broadcasts; which is sent from GPS_Service. The GPS Broadcast receiver sets the value of tabletLat and tabletLat to the value from the GPS_Service.
        Overrides:
        onStart in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment

      • onPause

        public void onPause()
        Called when the Fragment is no longer in foreground. It unregisters the GPS BroadcastReceiver.
        Overrides:
        onPause in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment

      • onSaveInstanceState

        public void onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Called before Fragment.onStop(). Saves the value of isConfigDone in a Bundle so that if the App is run again it will load the correct layout.
        Overrides:
        onSaveInstanceState in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState -

      • checkForCoordinates

        private boolean checkForCoordinates()
        Checks the Database table DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable if the Position data of the Fixed Station has been inserted by the AISDecodingService. If the data is inserted it sets latitude and longitude to the received values.
        Returns:
        true if packet has been received.

      • changeLayout

        private void changeLayout()
        Called when an AIS Packet (Position Report) is received from the Fixed Station. It changes the Layout of the fragment. It hides the ProgressBar and the waiting message and replaces it with a new layout which shows the Latitude and Longitude of the AIS Station and Tablet. If this is the second station being deployed (meaning it is the x-Axis marker) it changes the text of the Next button to 'Start Setup'.

      • populateTabLocation

        private void populateTabLocation()
        Populates the current latitude and longitude of the tablet on their respective fields on the layout. If the current latitude and longitude are not available it will populate the last know location from getLastKnownLocation().

      • onClick

        public void onClick(android.view.View v)
        Default callback method for the Buttons on the screen. Depending on the button tapped calls their respective callback functions.
        Specified by:
        onClick in interface android.view.View.OnClickListener
        Parameters:
        v -

      • removeMMSIfromDBTable

        private void removeMMSIfromDBTable()
        Removes the MMSINumber from the Database tables DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable, DatabaseHelper.baseStationTable and DatabaseHelper.stationListTable. Called when a position report is not received within the specified time interval or when the cancel button is pressed.

      • onClickBtn

        private void onClickBtn()
        Callback function for Next/Start Setup button on the Screen. Checks the number of Fixed/Base Stations installed. If two stations (meaning both Origin and x-Axis Marker) have been deployed it starts the SetupActivity. If only one station is installed (meaning only Origin) it will call the MMSIFragment to insert the second station (x-Axis marker).

      • getLastKnownLocation

        private android.location.Location getLastKnownLocation()
        Return the last known location by reading all last location from all LocationProviders.
        Returns:
        the most accurate last known Location
